title: Workplace Communication
objective: Develop the ability to interact professionally at the workplace using formal expressions and polite requests.
examples: Could you please send me the report?
I will follow up with the manager.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to develop the ability to interact professionally at the workplace using formal expressions and polite requests.

title: Tools and Equipment
objective: Identify and describe common tools and equipment used in technical professions.
examples: This is a voltmeter.
We use pliers to hold the wire.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to identify and describe common tools and equipment used in technical professions.

title: Safety at Work
objective: Understand safety vocabulary and communicate risks or preventive actions in a technical environment.
examples: Always wear protective gloves.
There is a high voltage warning.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to understand safety vocabulary and communicate risks or preventive actions in a technical environment.

title: Following Instructions
objective: Learn to follow and give step-by-step technical instructions using imperatives and sequencing expressions.
examples: First, unplug the device.
Then, remove the screws.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to follow and give step-by-step technical instructions using imperatives and sequencing expressions.

title: Technical Descriptions
objective: Describe machines, systems, and parts using technical vocabulary and appropriate grammar.
examples: The motor has a power output of 1200 watts.
It consists of three main components.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to describe machines, systems, and parts using technical vocabulary and appropriate grammar.

title: Work Orders and Requests
objective: Understand and fill out work orders, requests, and service forms accurately.
examples: The technician requested a new fuse.
Complete the service report before 5 p.m.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to understand and fill out work orders, requests, and service forms accurately.

title: Email and Report Writing
objective: Write basic professional emails and short technical reports clearly and concisely.
examples: Subject: Request for Maintenance
Attached is the summary of the inspection.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to write basic professional emails and short technical reports clearly and concisely.

title: Measurements and Units
objective: Interpret and express measurements, quantities, and units of length, weight, and volume in English.
examples: The wire is 3.5 meters long.
The container holds 20 liters.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to interpret and express measurements, quantities, and units of length, weight, and volume in english.

title: Diagrams and Manuals
objective: Read and interpret technical diagrams, schematics, and user manuals.
examples: Refer to the circuit diagram on page 5.
This symbol indicates a ground connection.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to read and interpret technical diagrams, schematics, and user manuals.

title: Customer Service
objective: Handle basic customer interactions such as providing information, support, and solutions.
examples: How can I help you today?
Let me check that for you.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to handle basic customer interactions such as providing information, support, and solutions.

title: Scheduling and Appointments
objective: Make and confirm appointments or work schedules using future forms and polite expressions.
examples: We can schedule the maintenance for Tuesday.
Iâ€™ll confirm the appointment via email.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to make and confirm appointments or work schedules using future forms and polite expressions.

title: Technical Problems and Solutions
objective: Describe common technical problems and offer or ask for solutions.
examples: The system is overheating.
Try resetting the main switch.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to describe common technical problems and offer or ask for solutions.

title: Workplace Instructions and Signs
objective: Interpret workplace signs and give/receive directions within a technical setting.
examples: Caution: Wet Floor.
This area is restricted.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to interpret workplace signs and give/receive directions within a technical setting.

title: Materials and Properties
objective: Talk about materials and describe physical and chemical properties relevant to a profession.
examples: Aluminum is lightweight and resistant to corrosion.
Plastic is an insulator.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to talk about materials and describe physical and chemical properties relevant to a profession.

title: Maintenance and Repairs
objective: Describe maintenance tasks, identify faults, and explain repair processes.
examples: The filter needs to be replaced every six months.
We repaired the leak using epoxy.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to describe maintenance tasks, identify faults, and explain repair processes.

title: Processes and Workflows
objective: Explain a workflow or process in a technical field using connectors and passive voice.
examples: The product is assembled in five stages.
Then it is packaged and labeled.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to explain a workflow or process in a technical field using connectors and passive voice.

title: Sustainability and Work Ethics
objective: Discuss eco-friendly practices, sustainability, and workplace responsibility.
examples: We recycle all packaging materials.
Honesty and punctuality are key values.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to discuss eco-friendly practices, sustainability, and workplace responsibility.

title: Interview and Job Applications
objective: Prepare for technical job interviews and understand job advertisements.
examples: Tell us about your technical skills.
Do you have experience with machinery?
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to prepare for technical job interviews and understand job advertisements.

title: Technical Vocabulary Review
objective: Consolidate vocabulary from previous lessons through matching, sorting, and quizzes.
examples: Match the tool with its use.
Choose the correct term for the diagram.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to consolidate vocabulary from previous lessons through matching, sorting, and quizzes.

objective: Complete a simulated technical task integrating reading, writing, listening, and speaking.
examples: Read a work order, complete a checklist, and write a summary.
Present your solution to a technical problem in pairs.
learningOutcome: By the end of this topic, students will be able to complete a simulated technical task integrating reading, writing, listening, and speaking.
